Package com.ibm.streams.operator.samples.patterns

Class PollingTupleProducer

java.lang.Object
com.ibm.streams.operator.AbstractOperator
com.ibm.streams.operator.samples.patterns.TupleProducer
com.ibm.streams.operator.samples.patterns.PollingTupleProducer
All Implemented Interfaces:
Operator
Direct Known Subclasses:
PollingSingleTupleProducer
public abstract class PollingTupleProducer extends TupleProducer
Abstract pattern class for an operator that produces tuples by polling an external source for information and converting that information into outgoing tuples. This class just provides the mechanism for polling, sub-classes implement fetchTuples() which will be called at the polling frequency.

    • setPollFrequency

      public final void setPollFrequency(long pollFrequency, TimeUnit unit)
      Set the polling frequency. Must be called in a sub-class's initialize() to have an effect as the values are read by startProcessing().
      Parameters:
      pollFrequency - Polling frequency.
      unit - Unit of the polling frequency.

    • setPeriod

      @Parameter(optional=true, description="Polling period in seconds. Tuples will be fetched every `period` seconds.") public void setPeriod(double period)
      Sets the polling period in seconds from the optional operator parameter float64 parameter period. Resolution from the value is milliseconds.
      Parameters:
      period - Polling period in seconds.

    • allPortsReady

      public void allPortsReady() throws Exception

      Calls TupleProducer.startProcessing() method immediately if initial delay is zero, otherwise asynchronously calls startProcessing() after the required initial delay.

      Starts processing by scheduling a fixed rate task that will call fetchTuples() at the configured poll frequency.

      Specified by:
      allPortsReady in interface Operator
      Overrides:
      allPortsReady in class TupleProducer
      Throws:
      Exception

    • startProcessing

      protected final void startProcessing()
      Instead of using TupleProducer.startProcessing to implement the initial delay, use the delay parameter of ScheduledExecutorService.scheduleAtFixedRate.
      Specified by:
      startProcessing in class TupleProducer
      See Also:
      • ScheduledExecutorService.scheduleAtFixedRate(Runnable, long, long, TimeUnit)
      • TupleProducer.allPortsReady()

    • fetchTuples

      protected abstract void fetchTuples() throws Exception
      Called periodically to fetch tuples from an external source and submit them to the output stream(s). Implementations will typically access the external source to fetch the available data, create OutputTuples based upon the data, submit them to the output ports and then return.
      Implementation must not block.

      When in a consistent region a submission permit is acquired before fetchTuples() is invoked and released once it completes.

      Throws:
      Exception

    • complete

      protected void complete() throws Exception
      Complete the operator by canceling the periodic task that calls fetchTuples.
      Throws:
      Exception

    • shutdown

      public void shutdown() throws Exception
      Complete this operator by canceling the periodic task that implements the polling.

      Sub-classes must call super.shutdown() if they override this method.

      Specified by:
      shutdown in interface Operator
      Overrides:
